intro: Hieracium olivaceum subsp. leptomnoon, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its leaves are lanceolate and usually have a hairy surface, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is known for its ability to spread vegetatively through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
